title: SQL JOIN - Basic Syntax
description: Learn how to perform INNER JOINs to combine data from multiple tables efficiently.
code:
SELECT a.*, b.column_name
FROM table_a a
INNER JOIN table_b b
ON a.id = b.id
WHERE a.date > '2024-01-01'
ORDER BY a.created_at DESC

title: Python Data Cleaning
description: Master data cleaning techniques using Pandas to remove duplicates, handle missing values, and normalize data.
code:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('data.csv')
df.drop_duplicates(inplace=True)
df.fillna(df.mean(), inplace=True)
df['column'] = (df['column'] - df['column'].mean()) / df['column'].std()

title: R Data Visualization
description: Create beautiful and informative visualizations using ggplot2 with aesthetic mappings and faceting.
code:
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  facet_wrap(~am) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = 'Motor Trend Analysis')

title: Tableau Dashboard Design
description: Design interactive dashboards with dynamic filters, calculated fields, and real-time data connections.
code:
[Sales by Region]
Dimension: Region
Measure: SUM(Sales)
Filter: [Year] = 2024

[Performance Metrics]
KPI: SUM(Revenue) / SUM(Cost)
Color: [Profit Status]
Size: [Order Count]

title: Excel Advanced Formulas
description: Use advanced Excel functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, and array formulas for complex data analysis.

title: SQL GROUP BY & AGGREGATE
description: Master GROUP BY clauses with aggregate functions to summarize data by categories.
code:
SELECT category,
       COUNT(*) as total_count,
       AVG(amount) as average_amount,
       MAX(amount) as max_amount
FROM sales
GROUP BY category
HAVING COUNT(*) > 10
ORDER BY total_count DESC

title: Python Web Scraping
description: Extract data from websites using BeautifulSoup and requests library for automated data collection.
code:
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

url = 'https://example.com'
response = requests.get(url)
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser')
data = soup.find_all('div', class_='data')
for item in data:
    print(item.get_text())

title: R Statistical Analysis
description: Perform hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and statistical modeling with R.
code:
# T-test
t.test(group1, group2, alternative='two.sided')

# Linear Regression
model <- lm(y ~ x1 + x2, data = df)
summary(model)

# Correlation
cor.test(df$x, df$y, method='pearson')

title: Tableau Data Connections
description: Connect Tableau to various data sources including databases, CSV files, and cloud services.
code:
[Database Connection]
Server: database.example.com
Port: 5432
Database: analytics
Auth: SQL Server Login

[Extract Settings]
Refresh: Daily at 2 AM
Incremental: ON
Filter: date >= [TODAY()-30]

title: Excel Pivot Tables
description: Create and customize pivot tables to analyze large datasets and generate summary reports.
code:
Data > Pivot Table > Create
Rows: Product Category
Columns: Year
Values: SUM(Sales)
Filters: [Region], [Quarter]
Format: Number, Thousand Separator
